objects.name: Welcome
objects.string: Heyy Guys, Are you ready for watching some history

content.text: [b]Welcome to The Taj Mahal.'Crown of the Palace',is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the southern bank of the river Yamuna in the Indian city of Agra. [/b]

parameters:
"[b]The tomb is the centrepiece of a 17-hectare (42-acre) complex, which includes a mosque and a guest house, 
and is set in formal gardens bounded on three sides by a crenellated wall.[/b]"
"[b]It was commissioned in 1632 by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan (reigned from 1628 to 1658) to house the tomb of his favourite wife, Mumtaz Mahal.it also houses the tomb of Shah Jahan himself.[/b]"

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
After adding this to an object, you have to **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Flash

eventsFunctions.description: Make the specified object(s) blink for the given duration.
eventsFunctions.name: Flash

parameters.description: Duration of the blinking, in seconds
parameters.name: FlashDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified objects are flashing.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFlashing

eventsFunctions.description: Stop the flashing of the specified object
eventsFunctions.name: Stop

propertyDescriptors.label: Half period (time during which object is invisible), in seconds
propertyDescriptors.name: HalfPeriodTime

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Gruk
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This behavior moves an object (like an enemy) for a chosen time or distance, then flips it and starts over, moving the object back and forth, vertically or horizontally.

Note: animations should be facing **Left** (for horizontal) or **Down** (for vertical) direction.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TimedBackAndForthMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This behavior moves an object (like an enemy) for a chosen time or distance, then flips it and starts over, moving the object back and forth, vertically or horizontally.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Move an object (e.g. enemy) for a chosen time or distance, then flip it and start over. 
Note: animations should be facing LEFT.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: TimedBackAndForthMirroredMovement

propertyDescriptors.label: Move the object vertically (instead of horizontally)
propertyDescriptors.name: Vertical

propertyDescriptors.label: position of the sprite at the previous frame
propertyDescriptors.name: LastPosition

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Make the object go on the left, then when some distance is reached, flip and go back to the right. **Make sure** that your object has **two animations called "GoLeft" and "TurnLeft"**.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AnimatedBackAndForthMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make the object go on the left, then when some distance is reached, flip and go back to the right. Make sure that your object has two animations called "GoLeft" and "TurnLeft".

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Make the object go on the left, then when some distance is reached, flip and go back to the right. Make sure that your object has two animations called "GoLeft" and "TurnLeft".
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AnimatedBackAndForthMirroredMovement

events.comment: Move the object to the left or right
If the distance "DistanceX" is reached, turn the object
At the end of the turn, go back to moving to th left (or right if flipped)

propertyDescriptors.label: Speed on X axis, in pixels per second
propertyDescriptors.name: SpeedX

propertyDescriptors.label: Distance traveled on X axis, in pixels
propertyDescriptors.name: DistanceX

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

Add the behavior to a Text object (or BBText object) and choose the interval between characters.

* When the text changes, the automatic typing starts again from the beginning with the new text.
* You can change the speed of the text typing by changing the interval with events.
* Use a condition to check if the typing finished.
* You can also pause the typing and resume it after.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for texts ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Add the behavior to the object, and it will get animated when the text is changed. You can also pause/resume it.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Text_AutoTyping

eventsFunctions.description: Execute actions when the auto typing text ends.
eventsFunctions.name: TypingFinished

eventsFunctions.description: Detect if the auto typing is on pause.
eventsFunctions.name: TypingPause

eventsFunctions.description: Change the time between characters being typed.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeInterval
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the interval between characters of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Add the behavior to the object, and it will get animated when the text is changed. You can also pause/resume it.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: BBText_AutoTyping
